comments:
With an old version of WFTPD 2.03 (which is still being shipped by Wind River to customers), I cannot connect to the ftp server.

Connect RSE to "FTP Only" on localhost.
Expand the My Home folder, enter user+pass.
RSE shows "Operation failed. File system input or output error".

The Error log shows the following exception:
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1444)
at org.eclipse.rse.services.files.ftp.FTPService.getUserHome(FTPService.java:517)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.getUserHome(FileServiceSubSystem.java:274)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.getRemoteFileObject(FileServiceSubSystem.java:197)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveFilterString(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:647)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveFilterStrings(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:473)
at org.eclipse.rse.core.subsystems.SubSystem.resolveFilterStrings(SubSystem.java:2219)
at org.eclipse.rse.ui.view.SystemViewFilterReferenceAdapter.internalGetChildren(SystemViewFilterReferenceAdapter.java:385)
at org.eclipse.rse.ui.view.SystemViewFilterReferenceAdapter.getChildren(SystemViewFilterReferenceAdapter.java:227)
at org.eclipse.rse.ui.operations.SystemFetchOperation.execute(SystemFetchOperation.java:197)
at org.eclipse.rse.ui.operations.SystemFetchOperation.run(SystemFetchOperation.java:101)
at org.eclipse.rse.ui.view.AbstractSystemViewAdapter.fetchDeferredChildren(AbstractSystemViewAdapter.java:1766)
at org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:207)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


When trying to expand "Root", RSE shows the following exception:
org.apache.commons.net.ftp.parser.ParserInitializationException: Unknown parser type: MSDOS A N (WFTPD by Texas Imperial Software)
	at org.apache.commons.net.ftp.parser.DefaultFTPFileEntryParserFactory.createFileEntryParser(DefaultFTPFileEntryParserFactory.java:118)
	at org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPClient.initiateListParsing(FTPClient.java:2358)
	at org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPClient.listFiles(FTPClient.java:2141)
	at org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPClient.listFiles(FTPClient.java:2188)
	at org.eclipse.rse.services.files.ftp.FTPService$1.run(FTPService.java:754)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)



The FTP Console shows the following:
220 WFTPD 2.0 service (by Texas Imperial Software) ready for new user
USER d
331 Give me your password, please
PASS d
230 Logged in successfully
PWD
257 "I:\" is current directory
NOOP
200 No operation completed successfully
CWD I:/
250 "I:\" is current directory
SYST
215 MSDOS A N (WFTPD by Texas Imperial Software)


-----------Enter bugs above this line-----------
RSE 1.0 Release Test
installation : eclipse-SDK-3.2.1
RSE install  : update-site RSE 1.0 complete
java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_08-b03
os.name:     : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 1
------------------------------------------------
systemtype   : FTP Only
targetos     : WFTPD 2.03
------------------------------------------------

The problem can also be reproduced with WARFtpd, available from
http://support.jgaa.com/index.php?cmd=DownloadVersion&ID=1

* Start war-ftpd.exe
* Press the "User Security Properties" button
* Add a user, name=d, password=d, homedir=I:\
* In Properties > Options > File System, choose "DOS/Windows"
* Press the "Go Online" button on the very left

Connect RSE as user d/d, when trying to expand folder "My Home" the StringIndexOutOfBoundsException is shown.
FTP Console shows:

220- Jgaa's Fan Club FTP Service WAR-FTPD 1.65 Ready
220 Please enter your user name.
USER d
331 User name okay, Need password.
PASS d
230 User logged in, proceed.
PWD
257 "\" is current directory.

When trying to expand "Root" with this ftp daemon, it shows the drives on my computer. But I cannot expand any of the drive letters, it always shows empty directories.

With the recent changes, RSE FTP client can successfully list the contents of a remote server using forward and back slashes. 

There are still issues dealing with remote files, mainly with download as, although the FTP commands are successfuly handled, RSE assumes that if the second character of a path is a ":" the separator required is "\". 
This assumption is not valid in WFTPD, for example. It can be seen in:

org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.getRemoteFileObject(String)
line 200:
>> String sep = PathUtility.getSeparator(folderOrFileName);	


One solution would be defining getSeparator in org.eclipse.rse.services.files.IFileService, so every Service could implement it and no assumptions had to be done. Something like:

public char getSeparator();
It's possible now accessing Windows FTP servers that uses '\' as a separato, as the wftpd 2.03 or 3.23.

traces.message: Unknown parser type: MSDOS A N (WFTPD by Texas Imperial Software)
